Author: acidbird#7266
Content: The app itself looks really like super early beta, there is still a lot can be done: design, ux/ui, if you are making a swap you still see the whole amount in your wallet, if you have smth locked you don’t understand it is locked until you try to move or trade funds, etc. If the team wants to create one universal place for crypto they will have to drastically upgrade the app, atm from design and ux/ui, content point of view it looks amateur and homemade. I am sure backend part is great but frontend has to be great as well in my opinion..

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: @fat3lvis though you may have more BTC available, the trading pair you are wanting to swap may not have the volume you are after (you can only buy as much as there is for sale).

Author: gcharang#6833
Content:
To check if you are invited to the AtomicDEX beta, 

Android:
```
Visit https://play.google.com/apps/testing/com.komodoplatform.atomicdex while logged in with the email submitted to the team
```

IOS
```
Check the inbox of the email address submitted to the team
There should be a "testflight invitation"
Follow the instructions in that email
```

actionslacks#4072
Content: @JvdP implementing z transactions will probably take some time. the fees are competetive with everything else out there afaik. my favorite feature, which you cannot get anywhere else, is the liquidity multiplier, or being able to place multiple orders and only needing enough crypto to fill one.

Author: az#1921

Author: az#1921
Content: but history is now empty. Sad, I loved to watch tens of successful swaps !

Author: Angelina#6231
Content: Time to swap more ! 😃

Author: JvdP#8992
Content: @actionslacks good point. The reason I'd like for z transactions to be included isn't the fees though (I see how my previous post would have led you in that direction, my bad), it's the anonimity. Everywhere else, you'd need an account to make your funds go "poof" for anyone who's watching you; on any kmdex, you'll just swap via arrr and off to wherever it was you where going and you're off the grid. So that would be the adoption booster in the arrr case, not so much the fees. And of course, then there the multiple use of funds you mention. 😃
